Hold onto your hats, space cadets!  Bengisu is joining us on an incredible journey to the red planet—Mars! Twin robotic explorers, ESCAPADE, are blasting off!

ESCAPADE, or Escape and Plasma Acceleration and Dynamics Explorers, are high-tech Martian detectives, ready to crack a cosmic case.  They're on a mission to solve the mystery of Mars's vanishing atmosphere!
Mars, a giant dusty beach ball, and the solar wind, a relentless force trying to blow away its air. Bengisu is excited to follow along!
ESCAPADE will investigate how this solar wind interacts with Mars's magnetic field, its tiny invisible shield. This research is crucial for protecting future astronauts and robotic missions.
These amazing robots just completed a pit stop in Florida, after a cross-country road trip from California! They're gearing up for launch this fall!
It's like prepping for an epic road trip – a spaceship checkup and a rocket fuel refill before the big journey begins. Bengisu can't wait to see them blast off!
ESCAPADE will hitch a ride on Blue Origin's super-powerful New Glenn rocket.  Think of it as a giant slingshot, launching the twins towards Mars!
Brilliant scientists and engineers from NASA and UC Berkeley, among others, built ESCAPADE. It's a true team effort, a testament to human ingenuity!
This mission will revolutionize our understanding of space weather and its impact on planets. Bengisu will be eagerly awaiting the results!  Get ready for liftoff, everyone!
